intro: Guatteria tonduzii var. leptopus, commonly known as the slender guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a smooth, waxy surface. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-white in color, and it produces berries that are edible but not widely consumed by humans. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitats, supporting local wildlife and contributing to forest biodiversity.
